content.question: Saepius ventis agitatur ingens pinus et celsae graviore casu decidunt turres feriuntque summos fulgura montes. (5) Sperat infestis, metuit secundis alteram sortem bene praeparatum pectus. Informes hiemes reducit Iuppiter; idem summovet. . . . In the passage above, Horace makes two related observations on the theme of "the golden mean." 1. (a) Write out and translate two images that Horace uses in lines 1-4 (Saepius . . . montes) to illustrate this theme. (b) Briefly explain how these images illustrate the theme.
